newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia palm olein remains high in late trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia palm olein remains high in late trading.

text.p: JAKARTA, Aug 21 (Reuter) Indonesian palm olein prices remained high in late trading on Wednesday as supply of both of crude palm oil and palm olein remained tight, traders said.
"Supply's still very tight. Rises on the Kuala Lumpur Commodities exchange have also certainly had an affect," one trader said.

Palm olein in Jakarta for immediate delivery rose sharply from 1,515-25 rupiah/kg in early trade to 1,550 rupiah/kg in late trading. Palm olein for early September delivery was at 1,500 rupiah/kg in September.
Some traders heard forward contracts for local palm olein as low as 1,475 rupiah/kg as export taxes are expected to be much higher in September.
No crude palm tenders were heard on Wednesday since Tuesday's 1,175 rupiah/kg tender in Medan, but sellers were said offering the next sale at 1,200 rupiah/kg.
